threats.title: Authentication Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker spoofs a legitimate user by stealing their authentication token.
threats.mitigation: Implement 2FA with TOTP. Encrypt all data with TLS so that the token can't be stolen in-transit. Use tokens with short expiration windows.

threats.title: Information Tampering
threats.description: Attackers might try to tamper the information stored by the application, performing malicious requests in order to do so.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS to encrypt every connection. Validate all user-provided input according to well-defined rules. Implement queries with prepared statements to prevent tampering via database operations.

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description: Users might try to deny having performed certain actions on the platform.
threats.mitigation: Implement robust logging solutions to ensure traceability and accountability of all performed actions.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Attackers might try to release information which should not be accessible to the general public.
threats.mitigation: Validate all incoming requests. Encrypt data in transactions. Ensure that RBAC is strictly enforced so that access to data is allowed according to the least-privilege principle. Sanitize API responses to ensure no detailed error logs are sent to the client-side.

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description: An attacker might attempt to issue a flood of requests to the backend, rendering it unavailable to respond to legitimate requests
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and request throttling measures to ensure that attackers can't flood the backend with requests.

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege
threats.description: A user might try to bypass access controls via insecure endpoints to elevate his privilege to an admin or park manager, thus becoming able to tamper with sensitive data.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict RBAC policies to ensure that users can't change their privileges. Re-validate the provided authentication token and match it with the operation being requested.

threats.title: Impersonation of Legitimate Customer
threats.description: An attacker may try to impersonate a legitimate customer by exploiting the absence of proper authentication mechanisms on the Customer Application side
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong authentication (e.g., OAuth2 or OpenID Connect)

threats.title: Action Without Traceability
threats.description: A customer might perform an action via the app (e.g., open the gate, book a parking slot) and later deny having done so. Without proper logging and authentication, it would be hard to prove otherwise.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong user authentication and session management and maintain secure, tamper-proof logs of actions with timestamps and user IDs.

threats.title: Park Manager Identity
threats.description: Someone could impersonate a Park Manager to gain access to park management functionalities
threats.mitigation: Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

threats.title: Park manager repudiates changes
threats.description: A Park Manager deletes or modifies data and later denies it
threats.mitigation: Maintain a secure, immutable audit log with user ID, timestamp, and affected data

threats.title: Tampering with system files
threats.description: An attacker might try to tamper with data that's written to (or read from) the filesystem.
threats.mitigation: Run the backend process as non-root so that it can't alter critical files.

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description: An attacker might try to perform several actions which require writing to / reading from the filesystem in a short period of time, thus rendering the system unavailable due to the processing of these requests.
threats.mitigation: Limit the number of concurrent filesystem operations the backend can perform. Limit the maximum file size for user uploads or generated reports.

threats.title: Obtaining Information
threats.description: An attacker might try to obtain information that's being written to or read from the filesystem without being allowed to do so.
threats.mitigation: Ensure that potentially sensitive data being stored on the filesystem (or read from it) through this data flow is encrypted, so that it cannot be disclosed.

threats.title: Modification of REST request content
threats.description: The data exchanged via REST API is vulnerable to interception and modification
threats.mitigation: Encrypt all communications with HTTPS, verify request signatures server-side

threats.title: Data leak
threats.description: Data such as park configurations or access tokens are leaked over an insecure connection
threats.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS, avoid sending excessive data in API responses and apply data minimization

threats.title: REST endpoint flooding
threats.description: Someone sends a flood of REST calls, degrading performance or crashing the backend
threats.mitigation: Use rate limiting and DDoS protection mechanisms

threats.title: Modified API Requests
threats.description: An attacker intercepts and alters requests sent from the customer application to the backend API, potentially changing parameters (e.g., altering parking reservation details).

threats.title: Sensitive Data Leak in Transit
threats.description: Sensitive user data (e.g., location, personal info) might be exposed if intercepted during transmission between the app and backend.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt all communications using TLS and, avoid exposing sensitive data in URLs (using POST body instead).

threats.title: API Request Flooding
threats.description: An attacker or malicious user could flood the backend API with requests from the customer application, making the system unavailable to other users.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and throttling on the API endpoints and monitor and block abusive IPs or behavior patterns
